title.narrative: COMMUNICATION AND SOCIAL DIALOGUE

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, child rights are a priority in the public agenda and UNICEF is positioned as the authority in this issue, through the communication of gender-sensitive messages that mobilize people and resources., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

participating-org.narrative: RELAF RED LATINOAMERICANA DE ACOGIMIENTO FAMILIAR

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, child rights are a priority in the public agenda and UNICEF is positioned as the authority in this issue,through the communication of gender-sensitive messages that mobilize people and resources.

description.narrative: Using CRC@30 as core narrative was a successful strategy as it produced a consistent narrative and public presence during the wrap-up year of the CPD. This theme also lent itself very well to initiatives linked to highlight the rights of girls and other vulnerable groups, an important factor when developing and implementing communication and public advocacy activities during the year. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2020
